SENT.plain: Achondroplasia is a physeal dysplasia which leads to dwarfism secondary to a decrease in the proliferation of cartilage in the growth plate
This, coupled with normal persistent bone formation, leads to the development of short tubular bones
Achondroplastic dwarfism is among the more common types of dwarfism and is inherited as an autosomal dominant trait
Its incidence is reported as 1 in 26,000 live births
Most achondroplastic dwarfs have a normal life span
The selection and management of anesthesia for the achondroplastic dwarf must take into account a variety of anatomic deformities
The physiologic and hormonal changes of pregnancy further complicate anesthetic administration
We report the safe use of a continuous lumbar epidural anesthetic in an achondroplastic dwarf who presented for urgent cesarean section
